website_summaries.verdict: Stylish and scuba diving friendly. Automatic movement  will power your watch with kinetic energy.
pros: Water resistance to 990 feet and stands out for being suitable for scuba diving up to 98 feet for two hours
The diver's buckle with safety clasp will come in handy
cons: Some buyers are put off by the watch's thickness and weight

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this watch
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this watch!!! Fits well, looks awesome. Easy to see and adjust. It’s heavy but I think you get used to it and like it even more. It keeps very accurate time. This is my first step into Invicta’s and I am definitely not disappointed. I can not say enough good about this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Desdep

customer_reviews.title: Grand it is, for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with the Invicta Grand Diver. amazing how invicta can offer such great finish and and quality steel with Seiko TMI automatic movement for such little money. only con in the whole Invicta Diver range is rather weak lume. otherwise it would be just perfect, i have 8" wrist, rather large but not huge, this oversized watch doesn't feel or even look large on me. for those with smaller wrists perhaps the Pro Diver line would fit more. Power reserve is around 44 hours, winding is very comfortable, and it passed the ritual diving test few times already, so no issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with quality and customer service on this one.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several Invicta watches and loved them all. This one is the exception. The lens is dirty and hazy on the inside. I issued a complaint and was ignored. I don’t think I can recommend Invicta anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Smith

customer_reviews.title: Stylish lnvicta Grand Diver
customer_reviews.text: I really love this watch. Although it is a bit large and heavy, it seems to be well built. I find that the longer I wear it the more comfortable it feels. I think it is very stylish, looks remarkably similar to the Rolex diver watch at a fraction of the cost. I'm not comparing build or time keeping just looks. I'm happy so far, keeping great time.
customer_reviews.author: js1

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking Watch
customer_reviews.text: So far the watch is running great and like the weight, especially after removing the very heavy SS bracelet and replacing it with a black leather 22mm band that I ordered also from Amazon. I think it looks much better and is way more comfortable, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Really! $350.00 watch for $100.00? Yea well...
customer_reviews.text: Great Watch! Except the second Hand fell off. No, really. Woke up Having had worn the watch to bed; looked to see the time and there was the second hand horizontally at 6:00. I read in another review this happened but thought to my self " what are the odds of that happening often". Returned it with little faith in another. I really liked the watch.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Had to finally give up on owning this watch
customer_reviews.text: Liked the look, the feel and the appearance of the watch. What I did NOT like was that after going swimming several times the crystal developed a haze on the inside surface. Returned the watch for an exchange and the exchange watch did the exact same thing. This is a sign of moisture ingress into the body of the watch, completely unforgivable for what is supposed to be a "dive" watch. Amazon, as usual, was awesome with regard to their return/exchange policy. I will continue to be a loyal Amazon shopper, it's just that I will have to avoid this particular model of watch in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: the exhibition glass case back is my favourite feature as it really shows off the excellent Seiko ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really impressive watch and you really need to hold it and wear it to appreciate how well it looks and how expensive it feels. The dial and bezel in Black looks really well and the 47mm case does not feel overly big on this chunky divers watch, the exhibition glass case back is my favourite feature as it really shows off the excellent Seiko Automatic self winding movement with its nice Invicta detailing on the rotor. Invicta pro diver watches are the pick of the Invicta range for me and the accurate Seiko automatic movement is a proven winner especially when you factor in the amazing low price. Dont hesitate buy this watch you will Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Byrne

customer_reviews.title: I have had the watch for 6 months, Still great
customer_reviews.text: I have been a huge fan of dive watches my entire life. My father passed away a few years ago and he has a really nice Seiko that he bought back in the 70's and it lasted forever. This watch has a Seiko movement. If it were in a Seiko, I believe it would be 100's more. Especially if you are looking for a watch with a machined steel clasp, which is an awesome touch. I know some people have had issues with this watch, but mine has been flawless from day one. Summary: Great Watch, Great Value, Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Compton

customer_reviews.title: Solid Watch For the Money
customer_reviews.text: Solid watch for the money. I don't really love that the Invicta branding is so prominent all over the watch (dial, side of the case, clasp, etc), but it's hard to go wrong with for around $100. Buying the movement by itself would likely cost half of that. At 47mm, this watch is BIG, so if you have a small wrist, you might be better off looking for something a little smaller (perhaps the Invicta 8926ob). Invicta gets a lot of flack from higher end collectors, but if you're looking for a solid watch with Submariner-esque styling that costs roughly 100x less than an actual Submariner, this is a pretty good option for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas De Salvo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice watch
customer_reviews.text: It's big and heavy but for large wrist folks, its perfect. Out of the box it registered 4 seconds fast per day in most positions except for lying face down but only gained 3 more seconds per day on my timegrapher. Dial was sharp and clear and best of all it has the Hacking and hand winding feature automatic movement. I have several of these NH35A movements and they are very dependable. Any watch being subject to water diving should have watch checked by professional watch service for leaks. Don't put it in a bucket of water to test it! Best buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Great watch out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today. I love the look of it - the scalloped bezel like an Omega, the size - 47mm, and the weight. I already have the pro diver, 40mm and wore it almost every day for a year and it's very reliable. When I spotted this on sale, I had to grab it. Will update this review in the future, after I have had it for a while. I would recommend Invicta automatics.
customer_reviews.author: Gruesome

customer_reviews.title: Stays in time quite well, only one con.
customer_reviews.text: This watch stays in time quite well I have noticed one minute off every two or three days. The bracelet is quite durable and a pain in the butt to remove links. My only complaint is that the luminescence doesn’t hold a charge very well. It is quite dim at the end of the day under natural light
customer_reviews.author: Paul Colburn

customer_reviews.title: A great accessory! & great addition to collection
customer_reviews.text: I like invicta watches a lot this one no exception better than what I was expected. If you like big watches you like this one. Has a nice weight to it a attractive watch that will get a lot of attention and compliments. To me it's a watch that you can dress up with & or dress down casual. The clasp you won't have to worry about the watch falling off it's real tight not a cheaply built watch.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L Robertson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This watch is waterproof and can be worn while deep sea diving. It is a beautiful and well crafted timepiece that will stand the test of time (no pun intended!). My grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: kaycocco1

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking but one issue
customer_reviews.text: Great watch for the price. Only issue is that 2 of the pins that hold the bracelet together are starting to slide out. I caught them in time and placed a tiny drop of super glue on the bracelet to keep the pin from working itself out. These pins are not screw down they are pressed in. Took the watch to an invcita dealer who was out of the pins.
customer_reviews.author: J. Amato

customer_reviews.title: Looks  Awesome, does not keep time at all.
customer_reviews.text: The watch Looks and feels Awesome but it did not keep time at all. I followed the setting and starting instructions as laid out in the instruction booklet but it was running extremely fast from the beginning and at one point over an hour and a half fast. I let the watch run all the way down and started the watch again as instructed with the same results. I read similar comments on line about this watch and I really wanted this watch to work but it would just not keep even close to accurate time. I am hoping that this watch was just a lemon and I would even be willing to try another.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Dust under the crystal
customer_reviews.text: I had to edit my review of this watch. Although I still enjoy it, I have discovered dust under the crystal. You can even faintly detect a finger print. This is my third Invicta with dust under the crystal. The inexpensive pricing is appealing but I'm done with this brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scratches WAY TOO easy
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Invicta watch. The date view lens appears to be soo cheap it scratches wY to easy. See photo showing it is not viewable. Watch also seems to run a little fast. About 5 mins fast after about a 4-5 days. This is a daily wear watch and I work in a administrative office capacity
customer_reviews.author: Seann

customer_reviews.title: I own several Invicta watches in the "Dive" class and the Grand Diver is beautiful!. This watch is much larger than my ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW! When I opened the box I was astonished to say the least! I own several Invicta watches in the "Dive" class and the Grand Diver is beautiful!. This watch is much larger than my Pro Diver and resembles more of a classic diving watch. I am 6'0 and weigh over 240. this is not the watch for a smaller man below 175 lbs. It would look too big. My only suggestion is that Invicta put a band on these watches that has a wetsuit extension like the Luminox Navy Seals watches. The case is big, the automatic time piece keeps time well and the face of the watch is sporty yet classy. I highly recommend this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: As a life long watch nut my history is Rolex, Tudor, Heuer, omega and more. Been doling Out collection to grandkids. I bought this watch as it looked fun and different. Well, it weighs a ton! It’s beautifully constructed and keeps perfect time. I’m very happy with It! Price was really reasonable and I think the watch will provide good service!
customer_reviews.author: william harsh

customer_reviews.title: Dont miss out on a great watch just buy it.!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch!I looks like a much more expensive time piece.People will notice this watch,Its glowing capabilities in the dark are good enough I have a 7 1/2inch wrist you can look at the pictures I added I think it looks great and you will get used to the weight after a day or two.The only reason it didnt get 5 stars is I wish the bezel had a coin edge this one feels too smooth and hard to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Dantastic

customer_reviews.title: Great watch at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 invicta watches, 3 being the Grand Diver series. First off these are very good looking and very durable watches. I am rough on my gear, my watches being no exception. These watches hold up to the task. I have paid a lot more for less quality with some other brands. Highly recommend the Grand Divers.
customer_reviews.author: TODD B.

customer_reviews.title: It's worth every penny....
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised that this watch not only makes a elegant and rich presentation but it held up to the water resistance its claiming. I normally don't take my Submariner on vacations for the obvious reasons so I wanted something that I wouldn't be embarrassed to wear and function like a dive watch...I highly recommend this watch if u want a high quality, functional and reliable sport watch. Recieved many compliments.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Really a great watch
customer_reviews.text: Great looking watch, reliable movement. Extremely good value. I like this over the pro diver as the pro diver feels too small on my wrist. The lume is not so great, but not a real issue. I am not a fan of all the engraving and will be removing this. I also swapped out the band to a silicone dive strap which cuts the weight way down. Great watch... highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Kershaw

customer_reviews.title: Looks/runs great until the crystal fogs and time runs fast.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased thisa couple of years ago and love the looks and function, as it was my daily watch. After about a year, the crystal began to get a milky haze to it which was not from moisture or condensation. Also after about a year, the watch doesn't keep accurate time. It runs fast - picks up 6 to 8 minutes over 24 hours. I bought two other Invicta watches that were identical to the 3044 (except the color) and both of them run perfectly. Maybe I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep time
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this watch. It is very comfortable to wear it is bulky and beautiful. But after six months it stopped telling time and the automatic feature stopped it had to be manually wound and the time reset every two days. It is highly unreliable but looks good, save your money and get a better more reliable watch .
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Well made watch. Second in my collection.
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch. Looks well made but the rotating bezel seems a bit loose. Dont know if it should have a shimmy movement when you rotate the bezel. Dont know if it realy is water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh Ramsundar

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Black Friday and all I can say is for the price point you cant buy a nicer watch! Some reviews say its big and heavy but I don't think so what so ever. Its actually lighter and doesn't look as big as I anticipated. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great nice looking watch for the price. I got this watch as a gift for my husband and he seems to like it. the band was large so he did have to have 2 links removed from it. It did take a little bit to figure out how to set the time but he you tubed it and got it set. Overall, its a very time watch
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Durable good looking watch for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn my last one for 4 years and it still worked well despite wearing it for all kinds of activities that would damage a lesser watch including lots of splitting logs with a maul, I demolished a mobile home with a sledgehammer while wearing it and it has banged into many objects including the crystal which has only minor scratches. Mine was getting a little worn looking (up close) but otherwise looked and worked fine. I decided to get another and will keep my old one around just in case. I wore a Rolex Sea Dweller from 2006 to 2011 and this invicta is just as tough.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: If your wrist will fit, you should not pass it!
customer_reviews.text: TLDR - if it isn't too big for your wrist, buy it now! I've purchased quite a few watches over the last few years from Seikos to Orients, and have enjoyed most - but none come close to the value of this model. Solid end links, great looking and comfortable bracelet (much more so than the strap code on my Orient Kamasu), Seiko NH35 movement - you can't go wrong! I can see where smaller wrists may not appreciate the shear size, and it does have some serious heft, but if you can swing it this should be a no brainer. I wish I had purchased this before a few others, including my Invicta Pro Diver!
customer_reviews.author: John Blystone

customer_reviews.title: Automatic, affordable, & BIGG.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this watch so this review is about the present time. What I like most about this item is it is a grand diver. I don't have to worry weather it will survive around water. I also really like the echted writing grand diver & Invicta name on the watch. I have no dislikes for my watch to report for now.
customer_reviews.author: George Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great looks, without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for an invicta for my collection for a while. But didn't want a quartz movement. This model was just the ticket. Love the looks and the feel. Been using it nonstop. Accurate, beautiful, easy to read and the cyclops date window works great for me. I highly recommend this piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jose  Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Invicta 3044 Watch
customer_reviews.text: YES IT'S WATER PROOF, YES IT'S EASY TO READ; & YES IT'S ALSO "HUGE", LIKE STRAPPING YOUR ALARM CLOCK ON YOUR WRIST? WITH IT'S 19MM HEIGHT, I GUARANTEE U'LL HIT EVERYTHING WITH IT WHEN U MOVE YOUR ARM & HANDS.
customer_reviews.author: oldfox

customer_reviews.title: buy a automatic watch winder
customer_reviews.text: great time peace I love it but unless your ready to set the time and date every morning when you get ready to put it on then I suggest you invest in a automatic watch winder, you can get one for about $50 and it will save you a lot of head ache
customer_reviews.author: Barbara simpson

customer_reviews.title: It's an Invicta. 'Nuff said.
customer_reviews.text: It's the latest in my Invicta collection and, at the price offered on Prime Day, it was a no-brainer. If you're familiar with the brand I needn't explain why I love them. If you're not, buy one and find out. I promise you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: SW Santiago

customer_reviews.title: A fine watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Grand Diver automatic. The first is still in perfect working order. I just wanted another color. This one is just as grand as the first as the name implies.
customer_reviews.author: william daniels

customer_reviews.title: Actually something I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: Better then what I expected...like seriously I thought it was going to be fake but nah fam I looked up the serial number and it matched up...the automatic feature works great.. I keep on getting compliments so I don't really mind how big it is...its not like wow that's massive.. but like I didn't know watches that big look that good kind of thing... I would definitely get another for my friends or family they would really enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Junkie mechanism Amazon says Swiss but it is not
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch 13 months ago and last month it started loosing time 10 min a week so now I have to pay to get it fixed or find a replacement. The watch is very well made and the finish is excellent but can't live with the poor time keeping.
customer_reviews.author: Rmully

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love this watches , construction, material, built like a tank, with nice finishes, all edges, attention to detail . Why pay more for the same quality, amazon hreat.
customer_reviews.author: Danny G Graves

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: This watch is big and bulky, it sits well off of the wrist because of how thick it is, it looks very nice and is built like a tank, very heavy. It’s an automatic so as long as you’re wearing it it will run, when I wear another watch for a full day the watch stops and I have to reset it again, I think this watch is worth the money as long as you’re looking for a bulky watch
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rudolph

customer_reviews.title: Its a nice watch and it never needs winding, but...
customer_reviews.text: The watchband is way too big for me, I tried to adjust it to my size and its still too large.If you are a very big person I would recommend it, but not if you are average size with not huge arms or wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good after 2 months of everyday/night wear
customer_reviews.text: So far so good after 2 months of everyday/night wear. This is a thick and heavy watch, so if that is not your style, I would look at other watches. No problems wearing it in the shower, pool or lake.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Invicta’s Best
customer_reviews.text: You can’t go wrong with this watch, formal or casual this watch works perfectly. You can wear it everyday or in occasions it will always get attention.
customer_reviews.author: HeatLifer

customer_reviews.title: Great Time Piece.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch as expected from Invicta. I wanted a watch that was simple to use, but looked handsome...I got both. Set up was easy and I was even able to take four links out of the stainless steel watch band my self after watching a YouTube video. Crystal may seem large at first, but I forgot about that in about two minutes and love the feel and actual ease of telling time. Great product at a reasonable price from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: This is now my favprite watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Man!!! I love this watch! I wear it everyday. I have a large collection of watches and now this is my favorite. The watch is just the right size. I'm a big fella so I want something on my wrist that I can feel. I love the quality of the watch. It keeps time, it's sturdy. It's an everyday watch but still looks good enough to wear as a dressy timepiece. I love Invicta watches and I have a few but again, this is my favorite!!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Good watch. Have worn swimming and snorkeling with out any issues. I dropped it on the floor and the crystal shattered really easy. Invicta customer service is nonexistent. Have had difficulty finding a replacement crystal.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get a dive watch just in case I wanted to take up SCUBA again. I did not want to have to replace batteries every few years, so I decided to try an automatic watch. It is not as accurate as a quartz, but it keeps time reasonably well. If I am off more than a minute, I can just reset it from my phone or computer. I don/t bother to reset it every week. I figure it should work fine, and it was not very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Thomas Koogler

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in May 2014. This is September 2019. It has been boxed with my other watches all along. About 2 years ago the “glass” started turning opaque. No warranty. Just take the loss.
customer_reviews.author: NYC trailer park

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a dive watch.
customer_reviews.text: Don't ever wear invicta watches in the water --- EVER. They are cheap fauxlexes.....they serve their purpose. Super cheap look good and last a year or two. I destroy watches and have had several rolexes.....that cost me so much time, money and agony to maintain. I just buy this cheap junk and throw it away when it breaks. Repeat, Invicta does not make "dive watches"
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Substantial!
customer_reviews.text: I think "substantial" is the nice way to say heavy. Of course as with all Invictas, you get a lot of watch for your money. I wanted an automatic and challenged myself to keep wound (automatically) for a year. Two months in and so far so good. I like the exhibition back. What other watch company lets you have this much fun for less than a hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Busters dad

customer_reviews.title: handsome looking watch
customer_reviews.text: First impression when you open the box is WOW that's a handsome looking watch, clean lines, nice detail. I have large arms and so it fits me perfectly, but it is heavy watch but very well crafted so I don't mine. One issue I have is the date adjustment doesn't seem to work correctly so you have to change the date with the minutes hands. Lucky for me the Service center is down the street. overall I like the watch
customer_reviews.author: kevin m.

customer_reviews.title: I'd definitely buy again for an every day watch and all mechanical it has its charm definitely
customer_reviews.text: It is what it says it is ... it's a decent quality case and bracelet good packaging ... case and band are above what I expected for the under 90 dollar price point fit finish was great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Matthew shafer

customer_reviews.title: I gave it to a friend who like tacky watches
customer_reviews.text: The most tacky watch I have ever purchased. I gave it to a friend who like tacky watches.
customer_reviews.author: Wesson357

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Really nice watch. I tried the smaller 40mm case, sub homage they make to small on my wrist. This is just right. I liked it so much I purchased two of the black and one of the blue dial. The black one will be my everyday watch. Keeps great time.
customer_reviews.author: JoeMin

customer_reviews.title: I simply can't believe how nice this watch is
customer_reviews.text: I simply can't believe how nice this watch is....amazing quality at a ridiculously low price. I've owned the best of the best and have collected watches for over 25 years....I can tell you this is a very fine watch at a most affordable price. The fit and finish is superlative...every time I look at it I just smile from ear to ear...don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Gunfighter

customer_reviews.title: Price and durability in One Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: Very stylish & classy; all around watch. Rated high for diving, but I dont dive. Love the boldness and strength of the Pro Diver series. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: R Carollo

customer_reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW
customer_reviews.text: I personally own the following: Hamilton X-Wind Khaki, Tag Heuer Monaco - Steve McQueen, Tag Heuer Indy 500, Tag Heuer Carrera Limited, and a Gucci Tank (8600m)... this new Invicta is my new beach watch and is currently moving up the ranks for its style , feel and design. I swapped out the Stainless steel band with a StapsCo 22mm Carbon fiber band and the watch takes on a whole new look and feel! This is a great everyday/activity watch that looks the part without the worry of damage to both the unit or your wallet!
customer_reviews.author: Amin S.

customer_reviews.title: 44 mm vs 40 mm case makes all the difference!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 44 mm case so I can see it easier and nothing disappoints except the initial adjustment. I have never had a watch that was so difficult to remove a couple links out of the band. I had to take the watch to my jeweler to have extra links removed. Other than that, lives up to the Invicta name perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for an everyday watch that would also ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an everyday watch that would also accommodate my oversized wrist seven and a half inch if you're a big guy with big hands this is an affordable automatic good-looking timepiece if you don't want it oversized heavy timepiece Invicta also makes the Pro Diver series which is a more traditional size
customer_reviews.author: Don Landis

customer_reviews.title: Great submariner homage
customer_reviews.text: Really nice watch for this "reduced" pricenpoint. A little big by normal comparison but I can live with the heft. Keeps good time and really feels quality.
customer_reviews.author: nolan

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned another grand diver just like this. I beat the crap out of it and get a new one. The first one lasted 1.5 years. Still worked but ran a bit slower than it used to and I destroyed the bezel. I use this as a work watch as a chef. If I could find a pair for shoes that lasted a year in my kitchen I’d be amazed. I seem to have finally found a watch that can.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hundley

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch...
customer_reviews.text: Timeless design. Always looks smart. Would be happier if the power reserve was better. All in all, I can recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch for my son for Christmas and it already stopped working. I have had a number of Invictas but this one is a total disappointment. Spent $28.00 to send the watch back. Invicta sent me an invoice for repair for $120.00. Invicta stated the warranty did not cover the part that is broken. Customer service is a joke, no one will ever answer phone. Told them to keep it. Invicta's may become collectors items because they will surely go out of business at this rate. Do yourself a favor and buy a Seiko. They cost more but I have a Seiko Dive watch that's over 30 years old and it's still working.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite watch. I hesitated for a long time to ...
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite watch. I hesitated for a long time to purchase based on the size, thinking it might just be too big. It's just right. I have 50mm and 52mm Invictas and they seem much larger on my wrist. This one works for dress and casual and keeps time within seconds a month. I love the automatic movement... no batteries so the factory seal will stay in place. Great price too... just before the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Pritz, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Date will stop, and watch stopped completely after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Watch working from June 25th and stopped this morning. Waiting until Monday to speak to Invicta customer service. It is October 25th will update when I get more information.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch

product_meta.title: Invicta Men's 3044 Stainless Steel Grand Diver Automatic Watch, Silver/Black
product_meta.description:
Quality Japanese Automatic movement; Functions without a battery; Powers automatically with the movement of your arm Mineral crystal Case diameter: 49 mm Stainless-steel case; Black dial; Date function Water-resistant to 300 M (1000 feet)

Classically styled with powerful lines and featuring a precise Swiss-made automatic watch movement, the shock-resistant Invicta Grand Diver men's stainless steel watch is made for serious scuba fanatics with a water resistance rating to 300 meters (nearly 1000 feet). This large, round watch measures 47mm wide (1.85 inches) and 17mm thick (0.67 inches) and it's made from solid surgical grade stainless steel. It also offers a skeleton see-through caseback and molded diving helmet logos on the end pieces connecting the silver stainless steel bracelet band as well as on the screw-down crown. It's topped by a black unidirectional rotating elapsed time bezel with white markings. The black dial face is supplemented by Tritnite luminous dotted markers and arrowhead-style hands (with seconds hand). Other features include an anti-reflective crystal with magnifier, date function at 3 o'clock, and diver's buckle with safety clasp.



Automatic Watches

Automatic watches do not operate on batteries. Automatic watches are made up of about 130 or more parts that work together to tell time. Automatic movements mark the passage of time by a series of gear mechanisms, and are wound by the movement of your wrist as you wear it. The gear train then transmits the power to the escapement, which distributes the impulses, turning the balance wheel. The balance wheel is the time regulating organ of a mechanical watch, which vibrates on a spiral hairspring. Lengthening or shortening the balance spring makes the balance wheel go faster or slower to advance or retard the watch. The travel of the balance wheel from one extreme to the other and back again is called oscillation. Lastly, automatic movements come in different types, including movements that are Swiss-made, Japanese-made, and more.

Also referred to as self-winding, watches with automatic movements utilize kinetic energy, the swinging of your arm, to provide energy to an oscillating rotor to keep the watch ticking. They're considered more satisfying to watch collectors (horologists) because of the engineering artistry that goes into the hundreds of parts that make up the movement. If you do not wear an automatic watch consistently (for about 8 to 12 hours a day), you can keep the watch powered with a watch winder (a great gift for collectors).


An automatic watch is a mechanical watch that is self-winding. the movement of your wrist and body causes the rotor--a weight attached to an automatic winding mechanism--to wind up the watch. This automatic watch has 21 jewels that the gears turn on to protect the metal parts from grinding together. it needs no battery, but it will stop if you have been physically inactive for an extended period of time. If this happens, wind the crown ten times clockwise to start the watch and give it some reserve power.  Tritnite is a luminous material with an extended glow exclusively developed by Invicta in Switzerland and added to their timepiece hands and markers. When exposed to regular daylight, it will hold its glow for about 20 hours. 

 About Invicta
Latin for "invincible," Invicta was founded in La Chaux-de-fonds, Switzerland in 1837 by Raphael Picard, who believed that fine Swiss timepieces could be offered at modest prices. For more than a century, the company has created distinctive manual and automatic-winding pieces. In 1991, descendants of the Picard family reaffirmed the company's founding principle, and the invigorated Invicta has been growing ever since with one of the most widely diverse collections of precise Swiss timepieces on the market.




With its most inspired creations yet, Invicta demonstrates its technical and design prowess, offering timepieces of style for extreme value.

"We have long held firm to the belief that supremely crafted timepieces can be offered for extremely modest sums. It is the founding principle of our flagship and the radical notion that still drives us today. By being true to our convictions, we will continue to turn the balance of power, and deliver true Swiss luxury to anyone who desires it. Let all those who possess our timepieces and pass through our doors witness the quality, value and care in every piece we create, and the spirit of never-ending possibilities in everything we do."

These are the words that greet visitors and motivate team members inside the Invicta Watch Group's new worldwide headquarters. Emblazoned in stainless steel, it has been the Invicta message since Day One.

 With each new timepiece, the company sends up a flare for those looking to be defined not by how much they spend, but how wisely they spend. With its strong collections, the gutsy Swiss brand is guaranteed to keep attracting followers. 

 The art of the craft. Inside an Invicta Workshop

It takes years of training and a great deal of pride to achieve glorious Swiss timepieces by hand. But it takes guts and the courage of your convictions to make those timepieces affordable for everyone who appreciates them.

 At our Swiss workshops, we mix time-honored traditions with a little bit of horse sense every single day to produce the greatest values in the watch-making world.
